    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBox

        public TextBox()
        Creates a text box component, where the user can enter text by typing on the keyboard. It will be empty and 10 columns wide.

      • TextBox

        public TextBox(String initialContent)
        Creates a text box component, where the user can enter text by typing on the keyboard. The width of the text box will be calculated from the size of the initial content, passed in as the first argument. The text box will at least be 10 columns wide, regardless of the content though.
        Parameters:
        initialContent - Initial text content of the text box

      • TextBox

        public TextBox(String initialContent,
       int width)
        Creates a text box component, where the user can enter text by typing on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        initialContent - Initial text content of the text box
        width - Width, in columns, of the text box. Set to 0 if you want to autodetect the width based on initial content (will be set to 10 columns in width at minimum)

      • repaint

        public void repaint(TextGraphics graphics)
        Description copied from interface: Component
        This is the main 'paint' method for a component, it's called when lanterna wants the component to re-draw itself. Use the supplied TextGraphics object to draw the component. In order to find out how the size of your compnent (as decided by the layout), use the graphics objects and query for its size.
        Parameters:
        graphics - TextGraphics object to use for drawing the component and getting information about the drawing context

      • calculatePreferredSize

        protected TerminalSize calculatePreferredSize()
        Specified by:
        calculatePreferredSize in class AbstractComponent

      • keyboardInteraction

        public Interactable.Result keyboardInteraction(Key key)
        Description copied from interface: Interactable
        This method is called when this component has focus and the user has pressed a key on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        key - Key pressed on the keyboard
        Returns:
        Result of this keyboard interaction, this can for example be a hint to the parent container to move input focus to a different component or telling that the event was processed by the component and no extra action is required
